MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float32 GetThermalHeadroom(int32 forecastSeconds) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetThermalHeadroom (forecastSeconds As Integer) As Single
abstract member GetThermalHeadroom : int -> single override this.GetThermalHeadroom : int -> single

Docs.param: how many seconds in the future to forecast. Given that device conditions may change at any time, forecasts from further in the future will likely be less accurate than forecasts in the near future.
Docs.summary: Provides an estimate of how much thermal headroom the device currently has before hitting severe throttling.
Docs.returns: a value greater than or equal to 0.0 where 1.0 indicates the SEVERE throttling threshold, as described above. Returns NaN if the device does not support this functionality or if this function is called significantly faster than once per second.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GoToSleep(int64 time) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub GoToSleep (time As Long)
abstract member GoToSleep : int64 -> unit override this.GoToSleep : int64 -> unit

Docs.param: The time when the request to go to sleep was issued, in the SystemClock#uptimeMillis() time base. This timestamp is used to correctly order the go to sleep request with other power management functions. It should be set to the timestamp of the input event that caused the request to go to sleep.
Docs.summary: Forces the android.view.Display#DEFAULT_DISPLAY_GROUP default display group to turn off.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property IsDeviceIdleMode As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IsDeviceIdleMode { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns true if the device is currently in idle mode.
Docs.value: Returns true if currently in active device idle mode, else false. This is when idle mode restrictions are being actively applied; it will return false if the device is in a long-term idle mode but currently running a maintenance window where restrictions have been lifted.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property IsDeviceLightIdleMode As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IsDeviceLightIdleMode { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns true if the device is currently in light idle mode.
Docs.value: Returns true if currently in active device light idle mode, else false. This is when light idle mode restrictions are being actively applied; it will return false if the device is in a long-term idle mode but currently running a maintenance window where restrictions have been lifted.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void UserActivity (long when, bool noChangeLights);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UserActivity(int64 when, bool noChangeLights) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub UserActivity (when As Long, noChangeLights As Boolean)
public: virtual void UserActivity(long when, bool noChangeLights);
abstract member UserActivity : int64 * bool -> unit override this.UserActivity : int64 * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The time of the user activity, in the SystemClock#uptimeMillis() time base. This timestamp is used to correctly order the user activity request with other power management functions. It should be set to the timestamp of the input event that caused the user activity.

If true, does not cause the keyboard backlight to turn on because of this event. This is set when the power key is pressed. We want the device to stay on while the button is down, but we're about to turn off the screen so we don't want the keyboard backlight to turn on again. Otherwise the lights flash on and then off and it looks weird.
Docs.summary: Notifies the power manager that user activity happened.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WakeUp(int64 time) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub WakeUp (time As Long)
abstract member WakeUp : int64 -> unit override this.WakeUp : int64 -> unit

Docs.param: The time when the request to wake up was issued, in the SystemClock#uptimeMillis() time base. This timestamp is used to correctly order the wake up request with other power management functions. It should be set to the timestamp of the input event that caused the request to wake up.
Docs.summary: Forces the android.view.Display#DEFAULT_DISPLAY_GROUP default display group to turn on.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
